definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: So, you wish you were an odd number or an even number ?
sentences.chinese: 那，你希望你是单数还是双数呢？

sentences.english: The Chinese people stress to send gifts in pairs, for odd numbers are regarded as inauspicious .
sentences.chinese: 中国人送礼物时很强调双数，因为单数被认为不吉利。

definition: positive odd number (also written 奇數|奇数)/singular (grammar)
remainder (after rounding a number)/decimal part (of number after the decimal point)/mantissa (i.e. fractional part of common logarithm in math.)/small change/balance (of an account)
and so on/in a similar fashion
the left is for males, the right is for females (traditional saying)
to put together/to make up (a set)/to round up (a number to a convenient multiple)/resulting in...
consecutive serial numbers/chain (of supermarkets, hotels etc)/hyphen
tip given on a happy occasion (traditional)
the units place (or column) in the decimal system
